item.title: Fuel Crossfeed Valves – Fuel Crossfeed Valves 1 and 4

numlitem.para: All main tank fuel quantity indicating systems are operative, and

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Operate normally until main tanks are equal (i.e., EICAS Advisory message >FUEL TANK/ENG is displayed).
When EICAS Advisory message >FUEL TANK/ENG is displayed, push main tank 2 and 3 OVRD FWD and AFT pump switches to OFF and crossfeed valve switches 2 and 3 to OFF.

note.para: EICAS advisory messages >FUEL TANK/ENG and >XFEED CONFIG may remain displayed.

Because of the CWT scavenge system, expect fuel usage from Tanks 1 and 4 to be greater than from Tanks 2 and 3 after closing crossfeed valves 2 and 3. EICAS advisory message >FUEL IMBALANCE may be displayed. After completion of the FUEL IMBALANCE NON-NORMAL procedure and >FUEL IMBALANCE is no longer displayed, switch MAIN PUMP 1 and 4 to ON and CROSSFEED VALVE 2 and 3 to OFF.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to affected crossfeed switch: "___ FUEL XFEED VLV LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Secure the affected valve open as follows:
Access front wing spar. (Access for No. 1 or No. 4 crossfeed valves between inboard and outboard engines.)
Open the circuit breaker associated with the inoperative crossfeed valve and install DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier:
For crossfeed valve 1, open P6 panel FUEL XFEED VALVE ENG 1 circuit breaker.
For crossfeed valve 4, open P6 panel FUEL XFEED VALVE ENG 4 circuit breaker.
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from affected valve (AMM 28-22-02/401).
Position manual override lever for affected valve in the OPEN position and lockwire.
Remove DO-NOT-CLOSE identifier and close the circuit breaker opened above.
